initialize.title: Initialize Auto Claude
initialize.description: This project doesn't have Auto Claude initialized. Would you like to set it up now?
initialize.createFolder: Create a .auto-claude folder in your project
initialize.copyFramework: Copy the Auto Claude framework files
initialize.setupSpecs: Set up the specs directory for your tasks
initialize.sourcePathNotConfiguredDescription: Please set the Auto Claude source path in App Settings before initializing.
initialize.initFailedDescription: Failed to initialize Auto Claude. Please try again.

gitSetup.title: Git Repository Required
gitSetup.description: Auto Claude uses git to safely build features in isolated workspaces
gitSetup.notGitRepo: This folder is not a git repository
gitSetup.needsInit: Git needs to be initialized before Auto Claude can manage your code.
gitSetup.needsCommit: At least one commit is required for Auto Claude to create worktrees.
gitSetup.willSetup: We'll set up git for you:
gitSetup.createCommit: Create an initial commit with your current files
gitSetup.initializingRepo: Initializing git repository and creating initial commit...
gitSetup.readyToUse: Your project is now ready to use with Auto Claude!

githubSetup.connectDescription: Auto Claude requires GitHub to manage your code branches and keep tasks up to date.
githubSetup.claudeDescription: Auto Claude uses Claude AI for intelligent features like Roadmap generation, Task automation, and Ideation.
githubSetup.repoDescription: Auto Claude will use this repository for managing task branches and keeping your code up to date.
githubSetup.branchDescription: Choose which branch Auto Claude should use as the base for creating task branches.
githubSetup.branchExplanation: Auto Claude creates isolated workspaces for each task. Selecting the right base branch ensures your tasks start with the latest code from your main development line.
githubSetup.ready: Auto Claude is ready to use! You can now create tasks that will be automatically based on the {{branchName}} branch.

worktrees.title: Worktrees
worktrees.description: Manage isolated workspaces for your Auto Claude tasks
worktrees.emptyDescription: Worktrees are created automatically when Auto Claude builds features. They provide isolated workspaces for each task.
worktrees.mergeDescription: Merge changes from this worktree into the base branch.
worktrees.deleteDescription: This will permanently delete the worktree and all uncommitted changes. This action cannot be undone.

addFeature.title: Add Feature
addFeature.description: Add a new feature to your roadmap. Provide details about what you want to build and how it fits into your product strategy.
addFeature.featureTitlePlaceholder: e.g., User Authentication, Dark Mode Support
addFeature.featureDescriptionPlaceholder: Describe what this feature does and why it's valuable to users.
addFeature.rationalePlaceholder: Explain why this feature should be built and how it fits the product vision.
addFeature.failedToAdd: Failed to add feature. Please try again.

addProject.title: Add Project
addProject.description: Choose how you'd like to add a project
addProject.openExistingDescription: Browse to an existing project on your computer
addProject.createNewDescription: Start fresh with a new project folder
addProject.createNewSubtitle: Set up a new project folder
addProject.projectNameHelp: This will be the folder name. Use lowercase with hyphens.
addProject.remoteSkipDescription: Initialize git without setting up a remote
addProject.remoteGitHubDescription: Create or link a GitHub repository
addProject.remoteGitLabDescription: Create or link a GitLab project

remoteSetup.title: Set Up Remote Repository
remoteSetup.description: Connect your project to a Git hosting service

serviceSelect.githubDescription: Create or link a GitHub repository
serviceSelect.gitlabDescription: Create or link a GitLab project

auth.title: Connect to {service}
auth.cliRequired: The {cli} CLI is required for OAuth authentication.

github.title: Connect to GitHub
github.cliRequiredDescription: The GitHub CLI (gh) is required for OAuth authentication. This provides a secure way to authenticate without manually creating tokens.
github.description: Click the button below to authenticate with GitHub. This will open your browser where you can authorize the application.
github.authenticatingBrowser: Please complete the authentication in your browser. This window will update automatically.
github.authenticatingWaiting: Waiting for authentication flow to start...
github.deviceCodeHelp: The browser should open automatically. If it doesn't, click the link below.
github.connectedDefault: Your GitHub account is now connected
github.manualDescription: The browser couldn't be opened automatically. Please visit the URL below to complete authentication:

gitlab.title: Connect to GitLab
gitlab.cliRequiredDescription: The glab CLI is required for OAuth authentication.
gitlab.description: Click the button below to authenticate with GitLab. This will open your browser where you can authorize the application.
gitlab.authenticatingBrowser: Please complete the authentication in your browser. This window will update automatically.
gitlab.authenticatingWaiting: Waiting for authentication flow to start...
gitlab.deviceCodeHelp: Open this link in your browser to complete authentication:
gitlab.connectedDefault: Your GitLab account is now connected
gitlab.manualDescription: The browser couldn't be opened automatically. Please visit the URL below to complete authentication:

repoConfig.title: Configure Repository
repoConfig.ownerSelectHelp: Select your personal account or an organization
repoConfig.ownerSelectHelpGitLab: Select your personal account or a group

github.title: Configure GitHub Repository
github.description: Create a new repository or link to an existing one
github.repoHelp: Enter the full repository path (e.g., octocat/hello-world)
github.createNewDescription: Create a new repository on GitHub
github.linkExistingDescription: Connect to an existing GitHub repository

gitlab.title: Configure GitLab Project
gitlab.description: Create a new project or link to an existing one
gitlab.projectHelp: Enter the full project path (e.g., mygroup/hello-world)
gitlab.createNewDescription: Create a new project on GitLab
gitlab.linkExistingDescription: Connect to an existing GitLab project
gitlab.errorInvalidFormat: Invalid project format. Use group/project or project

choose.title: What would you like to do?
choose.description: Choose how you'd like to add a project
choose.label: Choose
choose.openExistingDescription: Browse to an existing project on your computer
choose.createNewDescription: Start fresh with a new project folder

createForm.title: Create New Project
createForm.description: Enter project details and configure remote repository
createForm.label: Details

serviceAuth.title: Connect to {service}
serviceAuth.description: Authenticate with {service} to set up your repository
serviceAuth.label: Connect

repoConfig.title: Configure Repository
repoConfig.description: Create a new repository or link to an existing one
repoConfig.label: Configure

complete.title: Project Created!
complete.description: Your project is ready to use
complete.label: Complete

initialize.title: Initialize Project
initialize.description: Set up your project for development
initialize.label: Setup

customModel.title: Custom Model Configuration
customModel.description: Configure the model and thinking level for this chat session.

removeProject.title: Remove Project?
removeProject.description: This will remove "{{projectName}}" from the app. Your files will be preserved on disk and you can re-add the project later.
